titles: A true discoverie of the ground of the imprisonment of Francis Ellington, Thomas Cocket, and Edward Ferman whose outward dwellings is in Northamptonshire, who are cast into the common goale in Northampton by the men that are now in commission to do justice, who never read us any law, or any evidence came against us, shewing our transgression as the following lines make manifest : he that hath an eye to see, let him see, and he that hath an ear to hear let him hear.
author: F. E. (Francis Ellington)
notes: Signed: Francis Ellington (p. [7]), Edward Ferman (p. [9]), and Thomas Cocket (p. [10])
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
